intro: Psychotria borucana, commonly known as the Borucan psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants known for their ornamental and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. Psychotria borucana is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
